title: Angelo Mathews ‘absolutely shocked’ by Sri Lanka’s 2025 cricket schedule
byline: Having last featured in Sri Lanka’s tour to South Africa last December, Mathews on Monday said he was shocked that the team will be playing only four Tests this year, two of which will be completed before mid-February against Australia at home.

title: South Africa win Pakistan series to top Test table
byline: South Africa finally broke Pakistan’s resistance on the fourth day of the second Test to complete a 2-0 series win and finish top of the World Test Championship table.

title: Food waste habits cause for growing monkey population: Ecologist
byline: The main cause of the growing monkey population in the country is the habit of leaving behind reasonable portions of food, instead of discarding large uneaten quantities, Ecologist, Herpetologist and master wildlife photographer Mendis Wickremesinghe said.

title: Tibet earthquake: Nine dead as 7.1-magnitude quake felt in Nepal and India
byline: A powerful 7.1 magnitude earthquake struck a mountainous region in Tibet and neighbouring Nepal on Tuesday morning, damaging buildings and reportedly killing at least nine people.

title: Two killed in shooting in Mount Lavinia
byline: Two individuals, including a 20-year-old, were killed in a shooting at Watarappala in Mount Lavinia early this morning.

title: Should public be worried about virus spreading in China?
byline: In the wake of a mysterious viral outbreak in China, the health authorities are still up in the air whether it could lead to a massive outbreak worldwide like COVID-19 pandemic.

title: What is the HMPV which is spreading in China ?
byline: In recent days, news media outlets have been commenting about an increased number of respiratory infections in China, due to a virus, that many would not have heard much about. They are referring to the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV). This article would give a brief outline of HMPV infections and how they may be prevented.

title: Despite sterilisation, vaccination, irresponsible puppy abandonment continues: Veterinarians
byline: Although over 60% of community dogs have been sterilised and more than 80% vaccinated against diseases, including rabies, people continue to irresponsibly abandon puppies on the streets, Association of Veterinarians for Humane Management of Animal Population, Dr. Chamith Nanayakkara said.

title: Daily Mirror shines at Journalism Awards
byline: The Daily Mirror newspaper secured four accolades at the ’Journalism Awards for Excellence 2023’.

title: Colombo – Badulla train journey among World’s Best for 2025
byline: Lonely Planet has ranked the Colombo-Badulla train journey as the 7th best in the world for 2025.

title: Religious activities resume at Saman Devalaya
byline: Religious activities at the Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya in Ratnapura resumed this morning, following a two-day protest by the Kapuralas against the appointment of an Acting Basnayaka Nilame. The resumption of services came in response to pleas from local residents and traders, who had been adversely affected by the Devala’s closure.

title: Harsha quotes Daily Mirror on red rice shortage
byline: Quoting the Daily Mirror news article on ’’Queues are back’’, SJB MP Harsha De Silva questioned the government on the shortage of red rice and selling red rice exceeding the controlled price.

title: Private bus owners warn of islandwide strike if Ministry does not respond by Wednesday
byline: The Inter-Provincial Private Bus Association (IPPBA) announced plans to launch an island-wide bus strike if a discussion with Transport Ministry officials does not take place today to address several issues.

title: TRCSL urges public to buy phones with registered IMEI numbers
byline: While implementing the International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) Registration System, the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) is urging the public to purchase only mobile phones with IMEI numbers registered with the Commission.

title: Sri Lanka solidifies stance on One-China principle
byline: Ahead of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s visit to China, the Cabinet has approved a proposal presented by Minister of Foreign Affairs and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, for Sri Lanka to continue adhering to the One-China principle.

title: Overseas Sri Lankans can now obtain birth, marriage, death certificates via e-service
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism in collaboration with the Registrar General’s Department, has launched a pilot project aimed at helping overseas Sri Lankans to obtain online certified copies of birth, marriage and death certificates through Sri Lankan missions abroad.

title: President appoints High Commissioner and four ambassadors
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed a High Commissioner and four Ambassadors to represent Sri Lanka in its diplomatic service.

title: Canada’s Justin Trudeau cites ’internal battles’ as he ends nine-year run
byline: Under growing pressure from his own party, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has announced he will step down and end his nine-year stretch as leader.

title: MP Archchuna’s fate to be decided after committee probe: Speaker
byline: A committee is currently probing MP Ramanathan Archchuna, and his fate will be decided based on its findings, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne told Parliament today.

title: Concerns raised over GPS technology in efforts to relocate elephants
byline: The Wildlife Department’s plan to use GPS technology to drive wild elephants from areas between Anuradhapura and Wilpattu has faced criticism, with experts arguing that GPS alone is insufficient to move the elephants.

title: Partly built buildings under ’Langama Pasala Hondama Pasala’ to be completed: PM
byline: Partly constructed school buildings under the ’Langama Pasala Hondama Pasala’ programme launched by the Yahapalana government will be completed, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Government to act tough on quacks: Health Minister
byline: Admitting that there are unregistered doctors illegally practicing in the country, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today the government will take legal action against them and requested people to inform of such individuals.

title: Heavy smog diverts four flights from BIA
byline: Four passenger flights scheduled to land at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) were diverted to Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) and Thiruvananthapuram International Airport in India this morning due to heavy smog reducing visibility.

title: Only orangutan at Dehiwala Zoo dies
byline: The only orangutan at the Dehiwala Zoo has died, the Department of National Zoological Gardens said.

title: Tibet earthquake: Nine dead as 7.1-magnitude quake felt in Nepal and India
byline: A powerful 7.1 magnitude earthquake struck a mountainous region in Tibet and neighbouring Nepal on Tuesday morning, damaging buildings and reportedly killing at least nine people.

title: Govt. to tap migrant worker savings with Rs.744.75mn entrepreneurship scheme
byline: Sri Lanka is exploring avenues to channel foreign earnings into local investments to boost its economy, with plans underway to empower the returning migrant workers to reinvest their hard-earned savings in the country.
